DOC.brief_summary: This study is a comparison of different medical devices for infragenual dilatation.
DOC.brief_title: Trial Comparing Different Medical Devices for Infragenual Dilatation
DOC.detailed_description: Dilatation and recanalisation of the distal veins (infragenual popliteal artery, tibiofibular trunc, posterior tibial artery, anterior tibial artery) by classical balloon dilatation or cutting balloon with or without stenting or by endovascular laser. This intervention happens only once; the duration of the intervention depends on the procedure and the original injuries(30 - 120 minutes).
DOC.criteria: Diabetes type I or II with diabetic angiopathy stage IIb to IV (Fontaine) Atherosclerotic patients with distal angiopathy stage IIb to IV (Fontaine) Acute ischemia Multisegmentaric damage above the knee Sepsis: acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS), Creactive protein (CRP) > 30, white blood cell (WBC) > 25,000 Acute myocardial infarction (AMI) during the last 14 days Operative contraindication Life expectancy < 2 years Blue toe syndrome (microembolisation)
